relation: URI of SOAP node which faulted, Node (1.2), faultactor(1.1)
textBeforeTable: xmlerr *xerr); oratext *uri, oratext *qname, xmldocnode *msg, xmlsoapctx *ctx, xmlelemnode *XmlSoapAddBodyElement(  Syntax Adds an element to a SOAP message body. Sets the numeric error code. XmlSoapAddBodyElement()     Sets role for SOAP header element. XmlSoapSetRole() Sets Relay attribute for a SOAP header element. XmlSoapSetRelay() Sets mustUnderstand attribute for SOAP header element. XmlSoapSetMustUnderstand() Sets Fault in SOAP message. XmlSoapSetFault() Determines if SOAP message contains Fault object. XmlSoapHasFault() Gets role from SOAP header element. XmlSoapGetRole() Gets Relay attribute from SOAP header element. XmlSoapGetRelay() Determines the number of reasons in Fault element. XmlSoapGetReasonNum() Gets the language of a reason with the specified index. XmlSoapGetReasonLang()
textAfterTable: Parameter In/Out Description  ctx  IN SOAP context  msg  IN/OUT SOAP message  reason  IN Human-readable fault Reason  lang  IN Language of reason Returns (xmlerr) numeric error code, XMLERR_OK [0] on success See Also: XmlSoapSetFault() XmlSoapAddFaultSubDetail() Adds an additional child to Fault Detail. XmlSoapSetFault allows for creation of a Deatail element with only one child. Extra children could be added with this function. Syntax  xmlerr XmlSoapAddFaultSubDetail( xmlsoapctx *ctx, xmldocnode *msg, xmlelemnode *sub); Parameter In/Out Description  ctx  IN SOAP context
